name: The Disco Biscuits
biography:
The Disco Biscuits are an American jam band from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, formed in 1995 and recognized for pioneering the "trance-fusion" style that integrates improvisational rock jamming with electronic, trance, and psychedelic elements in extended live performances. The four original members met in the early 1990s as students at the University of Pennsylvania, initially playing covers of the Grateful Dead and Phish at fraternity parties under various names before settling on The Disco Biscuits in 1995.

The band's signature sound emerged when keyboardist Aron Magner incorporated a Roland JP-8000 synthesizer into his setup in late 1997, lending a distinctly electronic flavor to their improvisational jams. Bassist Marc Brownstein credits the improvisational ingenuity demonstrated by Phish during their 1995-97 tours as a particular inspiration. This eclectic mix of psychedelic rock, electronic music, soul, blues, jazz, and classical influences helped define their unique approach to live electronic music.

Beyond their musical contributions, The Disco Biscuits are known for founding Camp Bisco in 1999, an influential multi-day music festival that grew from 800 attendees to over 10,000 by 2009. In 2004, Marc Brownstein co-founded HeadCount, a national nonpartisan nonprofit organization that registers voters at concerts and has become one of the largest voter registration organizations in the United States.

The band has created live, improvised scores to films throughout their career, including Akira (1999), Tron (2015), The Fifth Element (2023), and 2001: A Space Odyssey (2024). In 2022, they began debuting their third rock opera, Revolution in Motion, which was released in March 2024. After 20 years with drummer Allen Aucoin, the band welcomed Marlon B. Lewis on drums in October 2025.
careerHighlights: 1995: Band formed at University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia
1997: Breakthrough show at Wetlands Preserve in New York City
1997: Aron Magner introduces Roland JP-8000 synthesizer, defining trance-fusion sound
1999: Founded Camp Bisco festival in Cherrytree, Pennsylvania
1999: Created live improvised score for Akira
2004: Marc Brownstein co-founded HeadCount voter registration organization
2005: Allen Aucoin wins drum-off competition at Borgata in Atlantic City
2006: Purchased DJ Jazzy Jeff's former studio in Old City Philadelphia
2015: Partnered with Live Nation, moved Camp Bisco to Montage Mountain
2015: Created live improvised score for Tron
2023: Created live improvised score for The Fifth Element
2023: Launched Biscoland festival at Wonderland Forest, New York
2024: Released third rock opera Revolution in Motion
2024: Created live improvised score for 2001: A Space Odyssey
2025: Marlon B. Lewis joins as drummer, debuting at Hulaween on Halloween
